column4: that's a huge question, as you've probably found out.  Many people have had success removing the network manager, some with wifi-radar, some with doing everything from the cli.  Try being more specific and maybe someone will have some advice.

sorry to single you out but you answered earlier :P i have removed network manager and put on wifi radar. but when wifi radar scans it says the same thing as if i was doing iwlist scan. it says "rausb0 - interface doesnt support scanning.
1. what card are you using, and  2. can you connect to the AP when you specify the values (i.e. not scanning)?
what is the model / chipset of your nic?
one problem I had was the encryption method I was using.  If you are using anything but WEP turn it off for diagnostic purposes.
and even WEP, too, really.  Can you connect from the command line?
can you connect when you specify all the AP parameters--i.e. without scanning first?
i have tried with the command line and editing the interface file
so you specify an SSID and then it doesn't show up when you do iwconfig?
that happened to me too.  Let me see if I can find the info that helped me.
just to make sure, you have no encryption on that router, correct?  And it is set to broadcast your ssid?
it must be broadcasting its ssid as other laptops can see if when not on the network. as for security its setup with 128 wep
1. make sure you're setting the key with iwconfig before you're setting the SSID and 2. try connecting with WEP disabled.
good luck
took security off altogether now, when doing a sudo ifup rausb0 , it looks for DHCPOFFER but doesnt revice any. dhcp is turned on on the router
you can try assigning a static IP address and see how that works.

you did an ifdown and an ifup on that interface?
